p: O. fieldingiana is a good source of flavonoids, biflavonoids, and fixed oils and is used in folk medicine, mainly for wound healing and relief of inflammation and infectious diseases. It was observed that O. fieldingiana extracts are important source of antioxidants. It was possible to isolate a biflavonoid among the more polar constituents of the leaf extracts, while from the seeds a flavonoid glycoside, kaempferol 3- O-rutinoside, was identified, which when tested in association with known antimicrobial agent demonstrated superior antifungal action in relation to all other tested materials.
